[center]The topic of Chapter 1 is possibility.
If the event described below is [b]possible[/b] (including events that are bound to happen)
[b]according to your knowledge[/b],
then left click the green box to answer "P" (Possible);
otherwise, right click to answer "NP" (Not Possible).[/center]
1. A standard coin is tossed. After it lands, its head faces up (it's still a standard coin).
2. A standard coin is tossed. After it lands, its head or tail faces up (it's still a standard coin).
3. A standard coin is tossed. After it lands, its head and tail face up simultaneously (it's still a standard coin).

You will receive a penalty when you submit a wrong answer,\nwhich prevents you from answering this problem for a while.\nSubmitting a wrong answer multiple times makes the penalty for this problem longer.
1. The worm that you find in restaurant food was dropped out of your own mouth.
2. The one that matches the fingerprint on the murder weapon is not the murderer.
3. You return home, and then find a stranger in your bathroom.
Hover over a piece of yellow text and don't move your cursor\nfor extra clarifications for the text.
1. Someone is holding a red apple that is not red.
2. Someone has experienced their first kiss without ever touching anyone.
3. A [color=yellow][hint=extremely thin]line segment[/hint][/color] is added inside a convex pentagon, which divides the pentagon into two triangles.
4. A [color=yellow][hint=extremely thin]line segment[/hint][/color] is added inside a concave pentagon, which divides the pentagon into two triangles.
1. A total of 5 objects are in a bag. Among the 5 objects, there are a total of 3 squirrels, and a total of 4 pieces of wood.
2. A total of 5 objects are in a bag. Among the 5 objects, there are a total of 3 pieces of wood, and a total of 4 balls.
3. A total of 5 objects are in a bag. Among the 5 objects, there are a total of 3 balls, and a total of 4 marbles.
1. An event that someone else claimed to have happened didn't actually happen.
2. An event that a book claimed to have happened didn't actually happen.
3. The scene depicted in an image didn't actually happen.
1. Dinosaurs did not exist.
2. World War I was fought against aliens.
3. The so-called "Newton's laws of motion" were discovered by Galileo Galilei.
2. You have never met your biological mother.
3. The day before yesterday, a nuclear war erupted on earth, with a death toll of over a hundred million people.
1. Your biological father's [color=yellow][hint=could be more than one date due to divorce]wedding date(s)[/hint][/color] and your biological mother's wedding date(s) do not share a same date.
1. When you were born, you saw a blue pigeon flying by.
2. Last month, you saw a blue pigeon flying by.
3. Last time you slept, you dreamed of a blue pigeon flying by.
[center]More specifically, the rule for answering "P" is:\n[b]When you are reading the problem[/b],\nthe event described below is possible according to your knowledge.[/center]
1. I just gave you a punch within the past 10 minutes.
2. Before you entered this level this time, the title of this level shown in the map was not "Memory 2". It was your name and your ID number instead.
3. This page does not contain a single word.
1. When you try to recall a perception that you experienced in the past, you couldn't recall the same perception.
2. Your current perception does not exist.
1. You once went to a toilet to poop and then walked away and forgot to wipe.
2. The time dimension does not exist.
1. A cloud of matter is floating in space. It has flashed a hundred million times of green light consecutively. However, for the next time, it will flash red light.
1. [color=yellow][hint=as known as F=ma, a law that describes the motion of objects]Newton's Second Law of Motion[/hint][/color] does not hold true for some situations.
2. A substance appears out of nowhere.
3. There is a thing that looks the same as an opaque solid cube, but when an object moves into it, the object clips through it, and neither receives resistance from the other.
1. After your body dies, you will continue to perceive indefinitely.
2. All the people in the world other than you [color=yellow][hint=like you are playing a single-player game]do not have perception[/hint][/color] all along.

1. Among the Essenceology problems that I released or will release, one or more of the [color=yellow][hint=the answer against which your submitted answer is compared by the program]reference answers[/hint][/color] that I set are wrong.

A runaway train is heading towards a switch track. Each of the two leading tracks has some people tied to it. Beside you is a level that controls the switch. If you do nothing, the train will enter a track with  5  people tied to it. If you pull the level, the train will enter the other track with  1  people tied to it(and this action will not be prosecuted by law). You should...
Do nothing
Pull the level

You are quarrelling with another person. If you punch them, compared to doing nothing, you will gain an additional pleasure of value 5, and they will suffer an additional pain of value 10. You should...
Punch them

You are quarrelling with another person. If you punch them, compared to doing nothing, you will gain an additional pleasure of value 50, and they will suffer an additional pain of value 10. You should...

In the scenario of the intro problem, a passerby A approaches. A does not know that there are 5 people tied to the first track, but aside of that, A knows everything given in the intro problem. Based on the information A knows, A should...

In the scenario of the intro problem, a passerby B approaches. B knows everything given in the intro problem, and B also knows that there isn't just 1 people tied on the second track, but an extra 9 people as well. Based on the information B knows, B should...
In front of you is a red button. If you press it, you have a 60% chance to experience a pleasure with a  value of 5, and another 40% chance to experience a pain with a value of 10. You should...
Press the button

There is a stack of three poker cards with values of 5, 7, and 9 respectively. After some time, someone will randomly draw one card from this stack, and you will gain a pleasure equal to the value of the drawn card. Now you should...
Remove the card with a value of 5 from the stack
Add a card with a value of 3 to the stack

In the last 8 days, the rainfall situation in location B, in chronological order, has been: NNYNNNNY. Today, you need to play outdoor golf. You should...

en: In the last 8 days, the rainfall situation in location A, in chronological order, has been: YYYYYYYY. The probability of having a rainfall in location B is 100%. Today, you need to play outdoor golf. You should...

In the last 8 days, the rainfall situation in location A, in chronological order, has been: NNYYYYYY. The probability of having a rainfall in location B is 75%. Today, you need to play outdoor golf. You should...
You need to wipe some oil off your mouth and some sweat off your butt, but you only have one tissue. You should...
Wipe your mouth first, then fold the tissue and wipe your butt
Wipe your butt first, then fold the tissue and wipe your mouth

You are on a platform. At the upper surface of the platform, there are 12 locations distributed in a [color=yellow][hint=3 rows, 4 columns]4x3 matrix[/hint][/color]. The distance between two horizontally adjacent locations is 200 meters, and the distance between two vertically adjacent locations is 100 meters. You are at the leftmost location in the first row, and you need to visit each location once. You should... (you move along the shortest path between locations)
First traverse the 1st row from left to right, then traverse the 2nd row from right to left, then traverse the 3rd row from left to right
First traverse the 1st column from front to back, then traverse the 2nd column from back to front, then traverse the 3rd column from front to back, then traverse the 4th column from back to front

20 clothes on the drying rack are all dry, and you need to collect them. The process is: you take a piece of clothing with yout right hand and place it on your left hand, repeating this for each piece of clothing. Finally, you leave and place the stack of clothes in your left hand somewhere else. You should...
Collect the clothes in order from lightest to heaviest
Collect the clothes in order from heaviest to lightest
(placeholder, subject to change)A high school student is about to choose a specialization. They should...
Choose liberal arts
Choose science

You need to take the subway to a certain place. There are two subway routes that go from here to there: one takes a long time but is very crowded, and the other takes a short time but is not crowded at all. It is known that regardless of which route you choose, the expected value of your benefit is the same. You should...
Take the route which takes a short time but is very crowded
Take the route which takes a long time but is not crowded at all

Class is about to start, and you need to get to the classroom before the class begins. You are currently in an underground passage, and the route to the classroom from here involves an upward escalator followed by a flat path. You can't walk the entire route continuously, as you'll need to stop and rest for 10 seconds midway. You should...
Rest for 10 seconds on the escalator
Rest for 10 seconds on the flat path
A crowd of people is scrambling for a free item. You should...
Join the scramble
Don't join the scramble
You are sitting on a bench. You need to handle some business at a nearby window, but there are about 50 people standing in line at the window. You should...
Go stand in line
Keep sitting
The college entrance examination may test the years of certain historical events. Someone is a candidate for this examination. They should...
A bag of candy and a stack of cash (100 one-hundred-dollar bills) are about to be destroyed, and you can only save one of the two.
Save the candies
Save the cash

[center]In the following section, you need to answer the [color=yellow][hint=relative to not making the choice]good and bad[/hint][/color] aspects
of making the given choice under the given scenario.
The good aspects to be answered are in the left column,
and the bad aspects to be answered (none in this question) are in the right column.
When answering, [color=yellow][hint=unless I omitted one or more when setting them. In this case, try other synonyms.][b]any[/b][/hint][/color] commonly used word with the right meaning will be automatically accepted.
For example, in this problem, you need to type in this window any word that means [b]pain[/b].
However, the input field for each problem has a character limit, and words that are too vague will not be accepted.[/center]
Should the torturous activities in military training, such as standing at attention, be abolished?
[color=yellow][hint=When going through torturous exercises, the body usually feels very sore and painful.]Pain[/hint][/color]

Some problems do not require you to answer all the given aspects;\nThe level is completed once the progress bar below is coompletely filled.\nThe more important your answered aspect is, the more the progress bar will increase.
After you have finished eating your bowl of rice, a few grains of rice remain stuck to the bowl. Should you eat them up using chopsticks?
[color=yellow][hint=After eating these rice, your need for food will slightly decrease, so less food will need to be made for you later.]Conserve[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=After finishing these few grains of rice, the person washing the dishes might find it easier, if the they are to be washed by hand.]Wash[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=It takes some time to pick up these rice.]Time[/hint][/color]
The aspects given are just some major ones and\ndo not necessarily cover all aspects.

There will be a feast in a few days, and now you need to order the ingredients from the farm. You can either order only vegetables, or order both vegetables and meat. Should you order only vegetables?
[color=yellow][hint=If you order meat, then the farm will slaughter more animals on average, causing more pain to the animals, if euthanasia is not used.]Pain[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=If there are only vegetables, it's easier to get tired of eating them.]Tasty[/hint][/color]
Your team is playing a soccer match against another team, and the temperature is very high. Should you do your best to play the match?
[color=yellow][hint=Generally, a match is more fun when both teams do their best to compete against each other.]Fun[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=Doing your best to play soccer is usually very tiring.]Effort[/hint][/color]
A game software needs to be made. The game can either be created by one person alone or multiple people cooperating together. Should multiple people cooperate together to make this game?
[color=yellow][hint=When cooperating, a part that one person is not good at can be assigned to another person, allowing their skills to complement each other.]Complement[/hint][/color]

[color=yellow][hint=Cooperation requires effort in communication, because without communication,\nit is difficult for each person to know how others are doing, and this is what needs to be known during cooperation.]Communicate[/hint][/color]

In high school, the teacher is asking you why you haven't handed in your homework. You didn't do the homework last night. You either lie and say you forgot to bring it, or tell the truth that you didn't do it. Should you lie?
[color=yellow][hint=If the teacher finds out that you didn't do your homework, then they are likely to get angry, and you are likely to get scolded.]Anger[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=If the lie is exposed, then the teacher is likely to get very angry, and their trust in you is likely to decrease.]Exposed[/hint][/color]
There is a person standing at the edge of the top of a high building wanting to commit suicide, and you are nearby. Should you pull them back?
[color=yellow][hint=He may experience a breif intense pain upon landing.]Pain[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=If they die, his family members and friends are likely to be sad.]Family[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=He knows his own experiences better than you do, so his choice is more likely to be the right one.]Knowledge[/hint][/color]
You were just bitten by a mosquito. It is now flying around you. Should you swat and kill it?
[color=yellow][hint=If you don't kill it, it might bite you again and make you itchy.]Itch[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=Killing it contributes to the eradication of mosquitoes, and once they are extinct, no one will be bitten by mosquitoes anymore.]Extinct[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=When you kill the mosquito, it may feel pain.]Pain[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=Killing the mosquito is kind of challenging and requires time and effort.]Effort[/hint][/color]
You have a delicious piece of cake. You can either eat it right now, or wait and plan to eat it later. Should you eat it right now?

[color=yellow][hint=If you don't eat it now, unforeseen events may occur later preventing you from eating it (for example, you die). So you should seize the opportunity and eat it now.]Opportunity[/hint][/color]

You see a piece of delicious cake in front of you, and there's another person nearby. It is known that this cake will either be entirely eaten by you or entirely eaten by them. Should you eat the cake?
[color=yellow][hint=The other person may not have perception.]Sentient[/hint][/color]
In the scenario of the problem "Lie", you should either choose one of the two responses immediately or take some time to think about whether to lie. Should you take some time to think?
[color=yellow][hint=After thinking, the choice made is more likely to be the one that should be taken.]Certain[/hint][/color]
[color=yellow][hint=The pause you take while thinking will expose that you are thinking whether to lie.]Exposed[/hint][/color]
